results.title: France panorama. [No. 69/47]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Vers le Paris o’lan 2000 (Paris of the year 2000) - Anb old suburb of Paris makes way for new buildings, subway and shopping centre. 2.ichel Blareff - a French pop star in action. 3. L’art Flamand contemporan a l’Orangerie (Contemporary Flemish art at Orangerie Museum) - Flanders a hot-bed of artists - Van Eyck, Rubens, James Ensore a modern contemporary currently on display. 4. La nature et l’homme (1970 is European nature presentation year) - Shows air pollution in the cities and increases in CO2 from aircraft etc; oil spills in the sea; crop spraying. 5. The Paris Observatory - Oldest still in service. Shows museum collection and modern equipment. 6. In memory of D’Ambroise Pare, the father of surgery (1585), henry II’s surgeon. 7. Painters as witnesses of their time - art and work 20th century depictions of people working.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 69/42]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Horse racing at the Longchomp Race Course. 2. An exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art by a Brazilian artist living in Paris. 3. The 56th Auto Show: Many impatient visitors flock to the show as France stops for what is one of the highlights for the year. 4. From the Moon: The Apollo XI mission is acclaimed in Paris. Many French dignitaries greet Neil Armstrong et al as they enter Paris as part of their world tour. 5. The Theatre of Paris celebrates the birth of J. Offenbach 150 years ago.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 69/39]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Shells vs gravity - empty space experiments at the ONERA. 2. Youth and alpinism - Chamonix’ new climbing school. 3. Dog-training a la Francaise - the opening of hunting season. Training the hounds. 4. Glass and crystal - Cesar at the Daum Crystal-Works in Nancy. 5. The arts - an exhibition entitled “Renior and his friends” in Troyes.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 69/35]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Bicentennial - the President of the French Republic in Ajaccio, Corsica, officiates over celebrations of the bicentennial of Napoleon’s birth. 2. Folk traditions - 11 nations take part in the 12th Annual International Folklore Festival at Confolens, in Charente. 3. Kinetic art - two Paris galleries and the Museum of Modern Art present exhibitions of Kinetic Art. 4. An old gem found again - after the Central Market of Les Halles moved out of Paris, Parisians rediscovered the Church of Saint-Eustache, a gem of medieval architecture and a regular museum, with an organ which is one of the finest in the world.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 69/32]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Problems de jeunes (problems of youth) - A new centre built in the shadows of the Eiffel Tower provides a 24 hour information and docmentation service for young people; a school for apprentice jockeys; a school to try and identify future sports skills in 6-12 year olds. 2. Sport d’ete (summer sports) - Ancient game of polqua - a type of hand ball played with scooper catcher. 3. Les Arts (the arts) - National Museum of Ancient Law.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 69/30]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. The Aerotrain - after trials at more than 400 kph the full-size Aerotrain is nearing completion. It will go into service between Paris and Orleans. 2. Beginning of a 7-year term: Presiden Pompidou receives the diplomatic corps at the Elysees Palace. The President’s first press conference. July 14th Bastille Day. 3. The concervatory contests - at the Theatre de Paris and the Salle Gaveau. 4. Omnipresent Napoleon - the numerous exhibitions retracing the life of the Emperor. 5. Car rodeos - stuntmen on wheels.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 69/20]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Lily-of-the-valley May Day - In Paris, on every street-corner, traditional May bouquets of lily-of-the-valley, and the market-porters brought their offering to the President of the Republic. 2. Notre Dame - Monsignor Marty, new Archbishop of Paris, is welcomed before the famous cathedral by the Diocese Community. 3. Knives and forks - In Saint-Denis, where Dagobert’s famous goldsmith, Eloi, had his workshop, the ancient art of the silversmiths is perpetuated. 4. Chatillon, an artistic center - Decentralisation of cultural and artistic activities in France has resulted in the creation of art centres in the suburbs around the capital. A good example is Chatillon-sous-Bagneux. 5. Royan, Fifth International Festival of Contemporary Art - Royan, on the Atlantic Coast, entirely rebuilt vollowing World War II, presents the Fifth International of Contemporary Music featuring Olivier Messiaen, Didier Denis and Karlheinz Stockhausen.
